posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Damaging Shield-Maiden [or Shield-Master]

Image source: https://i.pinimg.com/originals/df/73/61 ... dc7d94.jpg


Build goals:
This is a fascinating build draft that I was working out the finer details with @BlackCobra today.

- All the damage shields available in the game, usable in a practical sense 
-> Wounding Whispers, Death Armor, Elemental Shield, Mestil's Acid Sheath [potentially Extended]. 
-> Can further optionally add Aura vs Alignment (AvA) scrolls with UMD [the AvA scrolls have a 15 round duration] 
-> This allows for a five damage shield character (sonic, magic, fire, acid and divine damage).
- Epic Damage Reduction III for physical damage survivability whilst damage shields are up
- Bardic sweetspot for curse song/bard song (Bard 16+)
- Red Dragon Disciple for huge stat boosts and a useful Melee attack

Image source: https://wallpapersmug.com/download/1400 ... -glory.jpg

Build outcomes:
- Melee Base AB 39, Str 30 (capped at 42), BAB 25, Blind Fight/Knockdown, WF/EWF: Spear or Morningstar, Epic Prowess
- Base 478 HP (capped at 718 HP), +12 AC from Tumble 40/RDD, EDR III (Physical DR 9/-)
- Fort 30 (36) Will 23 (29) Reflex 19 (25)
- Level 17 Bard Song / Curse Song, Lingering Song [-11 AC to enemies with Curse Song/Taunt plus Dirge spell -> -2 str & -2 dex (-1 AC) / round for up to 17 rounds]
- Level 6 Bard Spells, Level 6 Sorcerer Spells, Extend Spell, Scribe Scroll, Craft Wand
- 274 skill points, I chose max Discipline, Taunt (or Concentration), Listen, Tumble 40, UMD & Spellcraft 30 modified, Lore 8(28), Search 9(12)

Wishlist:
Things that would have been nice but I was unable to include were: 
- Heavy Armor Proficiency
- Improved Knockdown
- Improved Critical
- Still Spell
- Max spellcraft for more saves vs spells
- Both Max Concentration & Taunt together
- Spot skillpoints to help against sneakers
- ESF: Taunt / Listen / Spot
- Extra Music feat
- BAB 26+ for an extra attack with all the AC lowering
- Sorc earlier for faster Mestil's Acid Sheath

Weaknesses:
- Arcane spell casters (Bigby's / Mords / Time Stop / IGMS spam) - a problem for all characters who are not high spell resistant Monks
- Dispels/Breaches
- Dev Crit users / Implosion / Petrification users 
- High sneak attack damagers
- Decent Archers particularly with Terrain
- Traps

Strategies to deal with weaknesses:
Arcane spell casters -> consider extended self silence spell (for the aura), Grizzled_Dwarflord Vicar of the Void style, then use breaches to remove their defenses + knock'em down
Dispels/Breaches -> consider spamming grease/evards or lightly buffed summon creature I spells to bait dispels out.
Dev Crit users / Sneakers -> consider damage shields + Shapechange spell (Iron Golem) via UMD for crit/sneak immunity
Implosion -> consider extended self silence spell and boosting Fort against spells close to 40
Petrification users -> damage shields & Shapechange (Iron Golem), killing from range with Ice Storm / ILMS wands, if they are mages consider extended self silence 
Decent Archers -> ILMS wands, maybe Bigby's 6 if they are not spell resistant
Traps -> find trap spell, wands of summon 1 to spring those traps, eventually pixie familiar to assist

So this appears to be very novel build concept and certainly an under-explored class combination.

Comments:
Thanks for reading this build draft, the numbers looked good here so I've shared this dual spellbook, 'spell-spear' with you. 
Hope you enjoyed reading this, and the play on words. 
The character is a 'shield-maiden' without a physical shield (standard spears are two handed in NWN), her shield(s) are the damage shield spells she uses.
Any suggestions/tweaks I would be pleased to hear them.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content: Nice idea.  However, I see a few issues for melee.  The low AC and EDR III in this build will not be enough, in my experience, to overcome heavy hitters and criticals.  Damage shields come late and not fast enough since you don't even acquire Elemental Shield until Level 34 and Mestils at Level 36.  This is made even more dicey since your caster levels aren't high enough to resist even ordinary dispelling.  What armor are you planning to wear?  Without Still, your primary function (damage shields) becomes highly problematic.  But I'm not sure how you can overcome this without giving up a few things.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Wizard 13 vs Sorcerer 13

With an ending Int score of 16+, one other possibility would be to swap Sorc for Wiz.

Wizard gets Scribe Scroll for free, allowing one extra pre-epic feat used for Heavy Armor Proficiency, and two bonus feats, one can be used to take Still/Silent Spell, the other to get Great Intelligence to access level 7 spells (which the build doesn't need, but is nice).

Taking a specialty school would be highly desirable for 1 extra spell per day / spell level.

The schools I would consider are: 
- Necromancy (Prohibited Divination: ie Identify, See Invis, True Sight, Clairaudience/clairvoyance, Legend Lore, Premonition) and 
- Illusion (Prohibited Enchantment: ie War Cry, Mass Haste)

Necromancy I believe is probably the best choice of the two.

Comparing Spells per Day / Level:
Sorcerer (Cantrips to Level 6 spells):
7/6 5/7 5/7 4/7 4/6 3/6 2/4

Wizard Specialist (Cantrips to Level 7 spells):
5 6 6 6 5 4 3 2
The key levels will be spell levels 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 which provide death armor, extended death armor, elemental shield, mestil's acid sheath and extended mestil's acid sheath respectively.
Sorcerer:
Death armor & extended Death armor: 14 per day
Elemental shield: 6 per day
Mestil's & Extended Mestil's: 10 per day

Wizard Specialist:
Death armor & extended Death armor: 12 per day
Elemental shield: 5 per day
Mestil's & Extended Mestil's: 7 per day
Wizard gets less shields / day, but there are still ample shields to cast / day, furthermore the two spare level 7 slots can be used for extended/still Bigby's 6, extended Mass Haste, or extended PnP tensor's transformation (if this is enabled in your environment), and a lot more versatility with crafting wands and scribing scrolls.

Overall I like the Wizard specialist (Necromancy) idea better, I think it provides the build a lot more.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks GDL for your comments - looks like you snuck a post in whilst I was writing.

The AC issues are something I have thought about.
The Bard/Curse song combo does help with effective +7 AB and +7 AC.
Tumble 40 (+8) and RDD bonuses (+4) helps as well, perhaps similar to the standard two handed fighter who would get only Tumble 20 + armor skin (+6 total) but have access to full plate armor (+1-3 over Medium depending if Dex is capped with Chain Shirt).
I can choose Morningstar and Tower for +8 AC in a +5 environment as well, but I would rather have the spear to annihilate opponents with that 30(42) Strength and use the Morningstar/Tower as a backup weapon at the cost of -3 AB (which with the AB bonuses + AC lowering should be ok).

The Wizard variant allows for Heavy Armor Proficiency, essentially adding 3 AC from the beginning by being able to equip full plate.
I like the Wizard variant and this is probably a good way to deal with the AC issue you have brought up.
It also allows for Still Spell which looks better to me.

Dispels / Breaches are a problem, but a good Spellsword can figure out a few strategies (such as the ones listed) to bait out these spells
The damage shields are only really designed to be used against dedicated melee opponents, who generally will not dispel you in PvM, although clever DMs love to stick random scrolls of Breaches and Mords on UMD users.
Clerics / Druids / Spellcasters need to be dealt by other means, which include a 42 str x3 crit spear, knockdown / Bigby's 6  or even an extended silence self-targeted spell for the aura.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
This is another idea I had, based on GDL's comments:
- replace wizard/sorc with PM 13

It loses wizard/sorc spell casting but gains +8 AC, crit and sneak immunity, and an epic energy resistance: acid, and a few free summons.

SirGunky used the same class amounts in Mini-Dracolich (Bard 17/PM 13/RDD 10) who built a dex based hero pursuing a high non-monk AC build in an intellectual exercise, quite different to what I am trying.

DaMouse404 wrote Clarissa the Punk Rocker (Bard 20/PM 10/RDD 10) which is pretty cool, goes EDR III with an AB of 36, it squeezes in lasting inspiration at 39 and RDD 10 at level 40 with the current split it allows for PM 10 / RDD 10 earlier, with more AB at the expense of LI (which comes late as well), if you're like me and retire characters after 40 then it just enhances playability.

Maximillan Kane's Cursed Half-Dragon Chanter a Bard 20/PM 10/RDD 10 build is similar to DaMouse404's build in that it tries the LI 39/RDD 10 squeeze but is more offensively focused with Str 38 and AB 43.
I chose to take a bit more HP (about 120 more) and leave AB at 42, there are heaps of AC/AB buffs in the build already.
I liked the Str 38 in that build which can be capped at 50. 
Nice feeling when you see that on the character sheet.

Anyway with all that AC sneak/crit immunity it didn't make sense to have EDR III anymore so I dropped it and boosted her offensive capabilities with her spear.  
Just wondering what you guys think. 

The dispel issue with the shields previously did bother me, it might be ok in some environments but by going PM I can just forget about them and just have massive AC and crit/sneak immunity. 
If I want some shields I can cast wounding whispers but they might struggle to hit me now.

posts.content:
I like Andariel, its very simple and powerful. With 42 Str (buffable to 54) with a scythe and knockdown/improved disarm it's hitting some high notes.

In comparison with this build I wanted the Bardic sweetspot (level 16+) for effective +7AB / +7AC to the whole party with Bard & Curse Song, plus a lot of spellcasting & craft wand. I've traded EMA, EW and some PM AC for this. 
It's stronger in a party as a result at the expense of these powerful defensive abilities. 
Solo this build should do fine too.

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
This combination is quite strong, I have only a question: why not maximize concentration?
It would be a pity if a taunt could decrease that PM AC....

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
They are both good choices
I think solo its pretty even between the two, possibly favoring concentration allowing for spells to be cast in combat with still spell.

In a party I thought taunt might be more useful, as you are not always the target, and lowering enemies AC by up to -6 (taunt buffed by bard song, and enemy concentration reduced by curse song) helps the party solve more problems

In terms of this character losing that PM AC from Taunt, if she is a PM then she probably doesn't worry too much about it.. 
She has +20 AC from Tumble 40, RDD and PM, if she loses 6 AC, her AC bonuses drop to +14, which is 8 more than the pure benchmark human pure fighter with Tumble 20 crossclassed and armor skin (+6 AC), 
If they hit her, she is sneak and crit immune, potentially buffed by stoneskin/greater stoneskin/premonition from UMD.
Opponents are flatfooted when they taunt, losing Dex/Dodge/Tumble AC, allowing her to hit them more accurately with her two handed spear with 38(50) strength.

That being said all the RDD / PM AC bonuses (which are not lost when taunting) plus Bard Song skill bonuses and Curse Song skill penalties for enemies does favour taunt being chosen over concentration.
But as mentioned its pretty even between the two in a solo setting.
In a party taunt I think is much more useful and I like to build more for parties these days than solo
